to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
near, with or among; often in general, to
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

2.brief: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)
uproar (as of rushing); by implication, destruction
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

3.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

properly, a refuge, i.e. (objective) security, or (subjective) assurance
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
near, with or among; often in general, to
to detrude, i.e. (intransitively and figuratively) become derelict (wrongly practise; namely, idolatry)

thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

near, with or among; often in general, to

to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
to bind fast, i.e. close (the eyes); intransitively, to be (causatively, make) powerful or numerous; to crunch the bones
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)

properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
